title: Quiz 1: Practical Exam - July 2021
description: Practical assessment covering MS Access patient database creation and MS PowerPoint presentation skills.

questions.question: Match the following fields from the Patient Database with their appropriate Data Types as per the instructions:
questions.explanation: Names are Text, Dates are Date/Time, Monetary values are Currency, and Boolean options (Yes/No) use the Yes/No data type.
questions.hint: Think about the kind of data stored (money, calendar dates, check boxes).

questions.question: In the 'Doctors table', which field was designated to be the Primary Key?
questions.explanation: Question 5 explicitly states: 'Make Doctors ID to be the primary key'.
questions.hint: Look for the unique identifier for each doctor.

questions.question: Arrange the steps to create a relationship between the Patients table and Doctors table:

items.text: Add both tables to the workspace
Drag the common field (Ward) from one table to the other

questions.explanation: To create a relationship: Database Tools > Relationships > Add Tables > Drag common fields to connect.
questions.hint: You must open the tool before adding tables.

questions.question: To show only Male patients in the 'Gender query', what specific text should be entered in the Criteria row under the Gender field?
questions.explanation: Based on the data provided (M/F), entering 'M' in the criteria filters for males.
questions.hint: Refer to the data table abbreviations for Gender.

questions.question: Which specific query type is required to CREATE a new table named 'Payment query' from existing data?
questions.explanation: Question 10 asks to 'Create a query to create a new table', which requires a Make Table Query.
questions.hint: This action generates a new object rather than just selecting data.

questions.question: To automate opening the 'Doctors Form', you must create a ___BLANK___ with the 'OpenForm' action.
questions.explanation: Question 11 asks to 'Create a macro to open the doctors form'.
questions.hint: This is a simple automation object in Access.

questions.question: In the PowerPoint section, the first slide is required to be a 'Title Only' layout.
questions.explanation: The instruction states 'Your first slide is going to be a title slide'. While similar, 'Title Slide' is a specific standard layout different from 'Title Only'.
questions.hint: Review Question 1 of the PowerPoint section.

questions.question: What specific font and size settings were required for the text 'COVID-19' and 'VACCINES FOR LIFE'?
questions.explanation: Question 3 specifies: 'Make the font... Arial Black and size 88'.
questions.hint: It is a heavy, thick font style.

questions.question: Which of the following data points were required for the Bulleted List on Slide 2? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The list included Pfizer Lttd, Best prices, 95% efficacy (not 100%), and Based in Italy.
questions.hint: Check the list provided in Question 4.

questions.question: What chart type was requested for the third slide to present the monthly efficacy data?
questions.explanation: Question 6 asks to 'Create a macro to open the doctors form'.
questions.hint: A chart comparing values across categories using bars.
